profile_positions.description:
Responsible for managing the Europe Export business unit- develop the Strategic Plan (3-year horizon) and Annual Plan, drive the commercial agenda through internal collaboration and joint business planning with our distributors to ensure acceleration across our key markets, and lead and manage a high-performing team of 3 Area Export Managers and 2 Trade Marketeers covering 23 markets. 

Main results: 
a) Accelerated operating profit growth by 60% in four years.  
b) Achieved market share growth of 12 percentage points in Albania to reach 33% MS YTD Aug ’21 and strengthen our market leadership, behind a strong Winning with Distributor agenda (Building Winning Portfolio and Channels, Picture of Success, Trade Census, Revenue Management, Excellent Outlet Execution and distributor development programs). 
c) Redefined the way of working with distributors to improve the level of execution in markets by ensuring the Pay For Performance scheme rewarded both input and output KPIs.  
d) Led Project Iceberg, a cross-functional strategic project to scope potential End-to-End savings for the Europe Export and the Europe License business unit. 
f) Co-created with two other Ambassadors the Inclusion and Diversity strategy for EMEA Export & GDF, and together built an I&D Network of 20 colleagues. In the 2019 Climate Survey, EE&GDF received an 86% favorable score on Inclusion (+7% vs Heineken norm).
profile_positions.title: Commercial Manager- Europe Export Business Unit

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for identifying organic top line growth opportunities for the International Brands Portfolio (Affligem, Amstel, Desperados, and Sol) in the Americas, Asia and Europe.

Main results:
a) Led with Senior Management stakeholder involvement all the stages of development for the Amstel Strong project in India (including bottle, recipe, packaging and positioning development, and TMLA negotiation), while managing challenging dynamics in terms of cultural differences and complex business context. 
b) Initiated and led together with the Group Brand Managers of the key markets Desperados SKU/Mix analysis and workshops to plot the right SKUs into the relevant gravity price points.
profile_positions.title: International Brands Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for identifying new launch opportunities for Desperados outside of Europe (Africa & Middle East, Americas and Asia Pacific), co-developing with the local and regional teams the business cases and commercial strategies, and guiding markets on brand and business development topics

Main results: 
a) Regions outside of Europe delivered volume growth of +149% vs 2012 (CAGR 14-12 74%) with regional footprint on total DSP volume increasing from 5% to 14%, while revenue grew +341% 
b) Desperados geographical footprint grew by 50% with 28 new launches (including Brazil, USA pilot, New Zealand, Vietnam and South Korea) between 2012 and 2014. Regions outside of Europe contributed 51% of the total FY growth in 2014
c) Developed the Desperados Incubator Book, a tool that allows markets to gradually build strong foundations for the brand on which we can accelerate growth in the future

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the development of the 3 Year Plan, the achievement of the sales volume, the execution of the marketing budget, the follow-up of the accounts receivables, the renegotiation of Trademark Agreements with licensees and distribution  agreements with distributors, and the identification of business development opportunities in 12 markets (Central America, Cuba and the Andean Cluster) For the last 16 months of my assignment, managed the Customer Service Organization for the Americas, which provided customer services and logistics support to 40+ export markets and 10+ regional OPCOs.

Main results: 
a) Sales volume growth + 91.3%, Revenue growth +98.4%, and EBIT growth +72%
b) Negotiation of termination agreements and new distribution agreements in Cuba, Honduras and El Salvador
c) Harmonization of the marketing approach and improvement in the level of executions across the area 
d) Appointed by the Americas Leadership Team to lead the commercial workstream of Project Merchant (integration of the three export operations within the Americas)
